intro: Fraxinus stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ash. It is a deciduous tree native to the western United States, characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically 4–8 inches long. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, which are followed by winged seeds dispersed by wind. Its bark is smooth and gray when young, developing shallow fissures with age. Fraxinus stenocarpa is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
